title: Augusta County: John N. Hull to a Friend, November 22, 1863
summary: Hull writes to a friend about his desire to leave Winchester. He also mentions a furlough he received on account of his typhoid fever, and talks about how hard it has been for the Confederacy to succeed militarily. Hull was a member of the 4th Va.
keywords: Desertion/Leave, Medicine/Hospitals, Troop Movement, Women, Regiment: 4th Va. Inf., Company: D, American Civil War
